conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the forces on blocks A and B using angles and pulley system to find mass of block B.

Image shows a smooth slope inclined at 30° with a light rope connected to block A, passing through two pulleys, and fixed to the ceiling. Block B hangs from the rope with 90° angle on both sides of the pulley.
The slope is inclined at 30°, so gravity on block A is resolved into components: parallel (mg sin 30°) and perpendicular (mg cos 30°) to the slope.
The parallel component (mg sin 30°) is balanced by the tension (T) in the rope on the left side of the pulley.
The 90° angle of the rope on both sides of the pulley implies tension on the right side (T') is perpendicular to the slope.
The component of tension on the right side (T' cos 30°) balances the weight of block B (mg_B).
Since blocks remain stationary, tension on the left (T) equals tension on the right (T').
Since T = T', T cos 30° = mg.
Equating expressions for tension: mg = mg_B / cos 30°.
Solving for mg_B gives mg_B = mg * cos 30°.
Mass of block B is mg * cos 30° / g = m * cos 30°.
